Description: Landscape with saints celebrated from December to March; in the foreground, St John the Evangelist holding a chalice and standing between St Longinus leaning on his lance, and a male saint carrying an axe; in the middleground, St Stephen carrying three stones, St Nicholas watching the three children stepping out of a vat, and four children carrying palm leaves and standing beside a female saint who is holding a candle with angel and demon hovering around it; in the background, St Sebastian tied to a tree, St Antony walking with a boar, and a nun; Zodiac symbols of Capricorn, Aquarius and Pisces in the sky Etching
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (58-61)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Evangelist
Representation of: St Nicholas of Myra
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca
